q: Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.
h:
“Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.” —
Simon Sinek

q: I would rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not.
h:
“I would rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Do all things with love.
h:
“Do all things with love.” —
Og Mandino

q: I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.
h:
“I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.” —
Charles Darwin

q: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
h:
“A loving heart is the truest wisdom.” —
Charles Dickens

q: We love the things we love for what they are.
h:
“We love the things we love for what they are.” —
Robert Frost

q: Life is a challenge, meet it! Life is a dream, realize it! Life is a game, play it! Life is love, enjoy it!
h:
“Life is a challenge, meet it! Life is a dream, realize it! Life is a game, play it! Life is love, enjoy it!” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Till it has loved, no man or woman can become itself.
h:
“Till it has loved, no man or woman can become itself.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
h:
“Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
h:
“Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life. ” —
Confucius

q: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
h:
“A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.” —
Judy Garland

q: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.
h:
“Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love, and to be loved, is the greatest happiness of existence.
h:
“Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love, and to be loved, is the greatest happiness of existence.” —
Sydney Smith

q: It's very strange that the people you love are often the people you're most cruel to.
h:
“It's very strange that the people you love are often the people you're most cruel to.” —
Kenneth Branagh

q: Any game becomes important when you know and love the players.
h:
“Any game becomes important when you know and love the players.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.
h:
“Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Duty makes us do things well, but love makes us do them beautifully.
h:
“Duty makes us do things well, but love makes us do them beautifully. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
h:
“If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: A woman unsatisfied must have luxuries. But a woman who loves a man would sleep on a board.
h:
“A woman unsatisfied must have luxuries. But a woman who loves a man would sleep on a board.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: All life is a manifestation of the spirit, the manifestation of love.
h:
“All life is a manifestation of the spirit, the manifestation of love.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
h:
“There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.
h:
“If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.” —
Maya Angelou

q: Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.
h:
“Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.” —
Kabir

q: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
h:
“Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
h:
“Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.
h:
“As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.” —
James Allen

q: It takes a minute to have a crush on someone, an hour to like someone, and a day to love someone... but it takes a lifetime to forget someone.
h:
“It takes a minute to have a crush on someone, an hour to like someone, and a day to love someone... but it takes a lifetime to forget someone.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: She who loves roses must be patient and not cry out when she is pierced by thorns.
h:
“She who loves roses must be patient and not cry out when she is pierced by thorns.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: It is easy to love your friend, but sometimes the hardest lesson to learn is to love your enemy.
h:
“It is easy to love your friend, but sometimes the hardest lesson to learn is to love your enemy.” —
Sun Tzu

q: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
h:
“We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
h:
“Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.
h:
“The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.
h:
“Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
h:
“What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.” —
Unknown

q: True love stories never have endings.
h:
“True love stories never have endings.” —
Richard Bach

q: It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.
h:
“It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
h:
“Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.” —
George Eliot

q: Great loves too must be endured.
h:
“Great loves too must be endured.” —
Coco Chanel

q: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
h:
“I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.” —
Og Mandino

q: The truly rich men are the ones who have health, loved ones and a work they love.
h:
“The truly rich men are the ones who have health, loved ones and a work they love.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.
h:
“Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.” —
Denis Waitley

q: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
h:
“He is not a lover who does not love forever.” —
Euripides

q: I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.
h:
“I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.” —
Judy Garland

q: It's not the love you make. It's the love you give.
h:
“It's not the love you make. It's the love you give. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: Life is love and love is life.
h:
“Life is love and love is life.” —
Elvis Presley

q: The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.
h:
“The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.
h:
“Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.” —
Rumi

q: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
h:
“The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
h:
“A thing must be loved before it is lovable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.
h:
“Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.” —
Roy T. Bennett
